marklogic.body:
If he can Spot that fastball with that kind of life and have that breaking pitch going like that, can't see why he wouldn't have SOME success this season. No reason to be talking about being a complete bust unless he's an idiot and doesn't adapt.
I think he'll be great if he can Spot the Off-speed stuff to go along.
The fatigue of going every 5 days as opposed to 6 might be visible towards the end of the season. However, he did pitch 232 innings in 28 starts. That's an average of 8.28 innings per start. So I don't really see any reason for him not to be able to go 6.5'ish innings/start with a higher WHIP over 30+ starts (barring injury of course) - ie: 200 innings or so.
